perturbation.original_text: Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than the last business day of the month Recipient received such invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within such period shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than 45 days after the Recipient received such invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within such period shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the payment deadline is the last business day of the month the invoice is received. The modified text changes the payment deadline to 45 days after invoice receipt, creating a direct contradiction and uncertainty about when payment is actually due. This ambiguity could lead to disputes over late payment penalties.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6.2 Termination of Services. Except as agreed by the Parties in writing or as otherwise stated in the Exhibits, Company may terminate for convenience any Transition Service, and RGHI may terminate for convenience any Reverse Transition Service, upon 30 days’ prior written notice of such termination; provided, (a) that, with respect to the Services described in Section G1 of Exhibit A, unless otherwise indicated therein, those Services may not be terminated independently except in accordance with an agreed Migration Plan and, (b) any unamortized costs associated with Provider’s purchase of any license or other costs incurred specifically for the purpose of providing the Services hereunder will be passed through to the Terminating Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6.2 Termination of Services. Except as agreed by the Parties in writing or as otherwise stated in the Exhibits, Company may terminate for convenience any Transition Service, and RGHI may terminate for convenience any Reverse Transition Service, upon 60 days’ prior written notice of such termination; provided, (a) that, with respect to the Services described in Section G1 of Exhibit A, unless otherwise indicated therein, those Services may not be terminated independently except in accordance with an agreed Migration Plan and, (b) any unamortized costs associated with Provider’s purchase of any license or other costs incurred specifically for the purpose of providing the Services hereunder will be passed through to the Terminating Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 30-day notice is required for termination of services. The modified text increases this to 60 days. This creates a conflict regarding the length of notice required, leading to uncertainty about which period applies, and potentially disputes if one party terminates with only 30 days' notice when the modified clause requires 60.
